title: Welcome to My Accounting Analytics Site
text:
Welcome! I’m a student in Sonoma State University’s accounting program, exploring data analytics in accounting. This website showcases my work:

Data analysis projects using R and accounting datasets
Course reflections on key concepts and applications
Professional development in accounting technology

title: 1 - Introduction to Accounting Analytics
text:
This week we learned about the fundamentals of accounting analytics and how data science is transforming the accounting profession.


Some real-world applications include:

Fraud detection using statistical models
Automated financial reporting
Predictive analytics for cash flow

title: 1 - Introduction to Accounting Analytics
text:
Code Example
Here’s an example of loading and exploring accounting data:

library(tidyverse)

# Create sample accounting data
transactions <- tribble(
  ~date,        ~account,      ~amount,
  "2027-01-01", "Cash",        5000,
  "2027-01-02", "Revenue",     -3000,
  "2027-01-03", "Expenses",    1500
)

transactions

# A tibble: 3 × 3
  date       account  amount
  <chr>      <chr>     <dbl>
1 2027-01-01 Cash       5000
2 2027-01-02 Revenue   -3000
3 2027-01-03 Expenses   1500

# Basic summary
transactions |>
  summarise(
    total_transactions = n(),
    net_amount = sum(amount)
  )

# A tibble: 1 × 2
  total_transactions net_amount
               <int>      <dbl>
1                  3       3500

title: 2 - Introduction to Accounting Analytics
text:
Quarterly P&L Metrics
Task: Fill in the blanks, inspect the output, then answer the question.

# Step 1: Build the monthly P&L table
monthly_pnl <- tribble(
  ~month,     ~revenue, ~expenses,
  "January",    50000,     40000,
  "February",   55000,     42000,
  "March",      60000,     45000
)
# Show the raw monthly data
monthly_pnl


# Step 2: Compute net income
monthly_pnl <- monthly_pnl |>
  mutate(
    net_income = _______   # Fill in: revenue - expenses
  )
# Inspect the net income column
monthly_pnl


# Step 3: Summarise quarterly totals
quarterly_totals <- monthly_pnl |>
  summarise(
    quarterly_revenue    = sum(_______),    # Fill in: revenue
    quarterly_net_income = sum(_______)     # Fill in: net_income
  )
# View the quarterly totals
quarterly_totals


# Step 4: Calculate profit margin
quarterly_totals <- quarterly_totals |>
  mutate(
    quarterly_profit_margin = _______ / _______   # Fill in: quarterly_net_income, quarterly_revenue
  )
# Final quarterly summary with profit margin
quarterly_totals

Questions:

Based on quarterly_totals, what is the profit margin for the quarter?
What does that percentage tell you about the company’s profitability this quarter?

title: 2 - Introduction to Accounting Analytics
text:
Expense Category Breakdown
Task: Create a one-month expense tribble, compute each category’s share of total spending, and answer the question.

# Step 1: Create your expense table
monthly_expenses <- tribble(
  ~category,        ~amount,
  "Travel",           _______,   # Fill in an amount
  "Meals",            _______,  
  "Supplies",         _______
)
monthly_expenses


# Step 1: Create your expense table

monthly_expenses <- tribble(
  ~category,        ~amount,
  "Travel",           10,   # Fill in an amount
  "Meals",            20,  
  "Supplies",         30
)
monthly_expenses


# Step 2: Compute percentage of total expenses
expense_pct <- monthly_expenses |>
  mutate(
    pct_of_total = percent(amount / sum(amount))  # share of total
  )
expense_pct

Question - Which expense category represents the largest share of spending?
